Job Title: Business Analyst Manager, Visual Innovation Services

Location: New York, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Strategy/Planning

Description:
Description

The Visual Innovation Team (VIT) helps build the world’s best online shopping experience through immersive photography, videography, and cutting edge virtual and augmented reality content. VIT is a large and fast-growing network of teams, focusing on content creation and standards across a diverse set of product categories. We are obsessed with innovating on behalf of our customers, and are continuously pushing the boundaries of the e-commerce experience.

We are seeking a Business Analyst Manager for our Product, Programs, and Analytics team (PPA). This role will be responsible for managing a team of business analysts, developing roadmaps to streamline access to business KPIs, and support projects that improve operational efficiency and or enable strategic shifts in our business model. The ideal candidate can balance data and customer anecdotes to influence decisions, has experience leading others, and dives deep into problems while distilling findings into concise action plans understood by a broad range of individuals.

Key job responsibilities

 Manage a team of business analysts responsible for ensuring key business decision data is accurate, automated and delivered in a timely fashion. Develop and influence roadmaps to improve data access and ease of deriving business insights to make tactical and strategic decisions. Work with partner teams to define business metrics/goals Manage end-to-end projects as needed

About The Team

The VIT PPA team is responsible for the development and continuous improvement of Content Creation workflows, tooling, and reporting that support our global operations, as well as dictating the organization’s adherence to Financial and Business Excellence best practices. We partner closely with production, workflow, reporting, corporate finance, and CX partner teams to ensure we are able to deliver internally and externally produced content at scale, on time, and at the required quality.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

New York, NY, USA | Seattle, WA, USA

Basic Qualifications

 5+ years relevant experience in program management/business analysis 3+ years people management experience Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders Experience in Excel

Preferred Qualifications

 Ability to communicate to a broad range of stakeholders Ability to work autonomously Effectively escalates to unblock as necessary Experience with Tableau, Quicksight, or other visualization platforms Experience with SQL Experience with Agile Sprint methodology

Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.
